original_title: Sri Lanka stocks close down, mixed sentiments
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – The Colombo Stock Exchange closed down on Wednesday, CSE data showed.
The S&P SL20 index was up 0.29 percent, or 8.71 points, at 3,048.
Turnover was at 1 billion. A large trade of LOLC General Insurance Plc shares boosted turnover.
Top contributors to the ASPI were John Keells Holdings Plc (up at 191.50), Ceylon Cold Stores Plc (up at 43.70) and DFCC Bank Plc (up at 79.70). (Colombo/Dec27/2023).
